alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:01PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Rio Blanco and east central Uintah Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles southwest of Dinosaur, or 35 miles southeast of Vernal, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dinosaur, Artesia and Blue Mountain. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 13. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 167 and 174. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
